Pre-Game Insights: The Cincinnati Reds are 76-83 this season and have lost three games in a row. They are coming off a series loss against Cleveland and have a 5-8 record in their last 13 games.
The Chicago Cubs are 81-78 this season and have alternated wins and losses over their last six games. They are tied for second in the NL Central and have a 4-5 record in their last nine games.
The Reds' pitching staff has a 4.14 ERA, a 1.26 WHIP, and a.240 opponent batting average. The Cubs' pitching staff has a 3.84 ERA, a 1.26 WHIP, and a.241 opponent batting average.
The Reds' offense has scored 696 runs with a.232 batting average and a.306 on-base percentage. The Cubs' offense has scored 732 runs with a.243 batting average and a.318 on-base percentage.
The starting pitchers are Nick Martinez for the Reds (10-6, 3.22 ERA) and Jameson Taillon for the Cubs (11-8, 3.41 ERA). Both have allowed one earned run or fewer in their last four starts.
The Cubs have a strong home record (42-36) while the Reds have a weaker road record (37-41). The Reds have struggled recently, scoring only three runs in their last three games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game is at Wrigley Field, a familiar venue for the Cubs.
The Reds have struggled against teams with winning records, while the Cubs have performed well against such opponents.
Others: The total runs line is set at 6.5, with trends showing UNDER performances in recent games.
The Reds have a history of UNDER performances in games against NL Central opponents, while the Cubs have also trended towards UNDER in their games.
